column5: What an awesome day it turned out to be!!!....met up with a buddy at 5:30AM this morning as a tag team to try and conquer the elusive Lake trout  ....  There was no match  ....we hammered them and gained another victory for the trout hunters  Every Laker that was landed today, weighed over 5lbs!!...the bite was constant...at one point we had a double header', but they both got off as well as a few others that were missed...  Here's some pics to share...
nice job!  good looking fish.  i see riggers, all deep?
Those are some very nice lakers where were you finding them. Deep , middle of the water column or up top.

I caught the first 2 on lead core....my buddy followed and quit using the rigger....10 colors out ~ 50' + another additional  some with the bait we were using...water temp was a surprising 68F...we marked lots between 50' and 120'....thermacline was at the 50' mark which explains the action we got
yeah for our team  , I hope ya got a pic with a tape measure in it somehwere if ya had one that rated well for us!!!!
Atta boy! Keep the inches coming! Looks like a blast out there, congrats!
Interesting sequences with the sign going from right hand, mouth, left hand.
EDITed
LOL....
it is a pretty good job on the photoshop, though..
Good Job, I never cought a lake trout, will need to try one day.
Great report and pics Steve!!!
He,s a juggler by profession LOL Nice fish bud.
Awesome lakers guys !!!!!!..  .job well done,great pics too....cheers
Jealousy.....making it....difficult....to type....     Nicely done!
Wow, those are some awesome trout, way to go  Great report.  Joey
Nice fishes sounds like good day on the water! Nice going, ehg
beauty report!!! guess I owe the team a carp now!  nice work
Thanks everyone!  You caught a nice carp the other night Jamie!!!....just remember to bring your team logo with you the next time
Congrats on a great day on the water! Some nice lakers!
Very impressive. Those are some nice lakers. Thanks for sharing.
